page.title: 03Ecology of Beeley Moor
page.content: {WEATHER:-}as the area lies at the eastern side of the Pennines, there is more precipitation, rain and snow with low cloud often prevailing. Temperatures are cooler due to the height of the land and exposed position. {CONSERVATION:-}much of the land is privately owned and closed to the public which has helped to preserve the area in its matural state. The Derbyshire Naturalists Trust has an interest in the area. {FOOTPATHS:-}though not well walked there are footpaths and bridleways reasonably preserved and signposted. {ANIMALS:-}the moorland and wooded areas provide food and cover for animals. The following have been seen: brown hare, badgers, foxes, moles, bats, rabbits, stoats, weasel, fieldmice and voles.
